properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snow and wind is expected. Total snowfall: 10 to 20 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 70 km/h except locally 90 along parts of the coast. Locations: Bay of Exploits, Green Bay - White Bay. Time span: tonight and Wednesday. Remarks: Snow is expected to begin tonight and continue on Wednesday. Strong winds will also develop overnight and continue Wednesday morning. Blowing snow is not expected to be significant as temperatures will remain near zero. Conditions will improve on Wednesday afternoon as snow tapers off to flurries and showers. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-09T06:17:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-08T14:18:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3493173894.2020
Area: Bay of Exploits, Green Bay - White Bay

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain along the coast with snow inland tonight and Wednesday morning. Location: Terra Nova. Rainfall along the coast: 25 mm Snowfall tonight: 10 cm inland Remarks: Driving conditions will likely be highly variable in this area due to the mixture of precipitation. Rain will taper off to showers and flurries on Wednesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: Westerly 80 km/h, except 100 along parts of the coast. Locations: eastern Newfoundland. Time span: Wednesday morning until afternoon. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locations: Gander and vicinity, Bonavista North, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity Buchans and the interior Connaigre (inland) Time span: this evening until Wednesday afternoon. Snowfall: amounts near 15 cm are expected by Wednesday morning, with additional accumulations between 2 and 10 cm occurring during the day Wednesday. Remarks: Temperatures will remain near zero, so this snow will be wet and heavy. Strong northerly winds gusting near 80 km/h will develop on Wednesday, but due to the compact nature of the snow, the risk of widespread blowing snow is low. Conditions are expected to improve late in the day on Wednesday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-09T17:34:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-09T01:35:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1001743970.2020
Area: Connaigre, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bonavista North, Gander and vicinity

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A frontal system will continue to give rain this afternoon as it tracks across the southern BC Coast. Approximately 40 to 70 mm of rain has fallen since last evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 5 to 10 mm are forecast before the rain eases this evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southerly winds will lift the snow and produce blizzard conditions over this community today until early Thursday morning. Protect yourself from the wind, the cold and disorientation by staying safely inside. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-09T12:09:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-08T20:10:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1095746493.2020
Area: Salluit

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A frontal system will continue to give rain today as it tracks across the southern BC Coast. Approximately 20 to 50 mm of rain has fallen across Metro Vancouver since last night. The rain will continue today and ease this evening, with further amounts of 20 to 30 mm expected. Over Howe Sound, 35 mm of rain has fallen since last night with further amounts of 10 to 15 mm expected today. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. A frontal system moving across the southern BC interior tonight will continue to give snow to parts of the Columbias. Across the Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass, additional 10 cm of snow is expected tonight, especially near the pass. Over Yoho Park-Kootenay Park, 22 cm of snow has been reported since Monday evening. Additional 10 to 15 cm of snow is expected by early Wednesday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-09T15:05:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-08T23:06:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3978047695.2020
Area: Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. A ridge of high pressure over the central interior has brought clearing skies to the region. Areas of fog have formed over northern Cariboo region - including Quesnel. Extensive fog are expected to form this evening over southern Cariboo, Prince George, and as far north as Bulkley Valley. Near zero visibility in fog is expected to persist through tonight. Conditions will improve Wednesday morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
